intro: Impatiens burtonii var. wittei, commonly known as the Burton's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy, and it produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
